adverb.description: In an ungainly manner; not smoothly or gracefully.
examples: she waddled up the stairs awkwardly
he landed awkwardly after both of his vaults
the conclusion seems awkwardly grafted on to the main text

adverb.description: In a way that shows uneasy embarrassment.
examples: Seth responded awkwardly, allowing the silence once again to settle between them

adverb.description: In a way that causes difficulty.
examples: the cruise control is placed awkwardly on the control column
the ball bounced awkwardly, but Auguste controlled it with his chest
